title: Second Council of Nicaea
description: The Seventh Ecumenical Council, restoring the veneration of icons while reserving worship to God alone (787).

content.text: This council met at Nicaea to resolve the iconoclast controversy in the Byzantine world, where religious images had been opposed and removed.

items: Affirmed that icons of Christ, the Virgin Mary, angels, and saints may be publicly displayed and honored.
Distinguished between adoration (worship) due to God alone and veneration shown to icons.
Argued that honor given to an image passes to its prototype, so icon veneration confesses the reality of the Incarnation.

content.text: Second Nicaea is received in the eastern and western historic traditions as the Seventh Ecumenical Council and remains foundational for classical Christian teaching on sacred images.
